channel.title: Current Project's GUI
channel.description:
Well here's the GUI for my current project that I'm working on, I thought about releasing the GUI but writing a tutorial that got all functions working without being source-specific would be near impossible =P.
[img]http://i29.tinypic.com/2z4kaqw.png[/img] ^ Site contacts included urls = advertisement. It amazes me that some people still don't know about using html in Java swing controls.
[img]http://i27.tinypic.com/34nffk7.png[/img] ^ exception color changing was probably going to be baleeted.
[img]http://i32.tinypic.com/xgip0y.png[/img] ^ Just quick reference Data that would load from your configuration files (.cfg)
[img]http://i25.tinypic.com/10fx7ac.png[/img] ^ select a player from the playerlist or type in a username and click the load button, gives many options to edit/fuck with the selected player ;)
Obviously the player information is blank and such as the server isn't running. The Data tabs would fill with information from your configuration files (autospawn.cfg, item.cfg, etc.) and the black box would replace the command prompt.
I got about half way through adding it to a random delta (I had originally planned on releasing delta based because so many people use it) but I realized that writing a tutorial would be difficult and making it work would be different from base to base.

item.title: Current Project's GUI
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote="`Trey, post:7, topic:290009"][quote author=Vira_ link=topic=383346.msg2878492#msg2878492 date=1248192473]

I guess if these work and have few bugs its great, good luck haven’t seen many people doing GUI’s any more.

The reason I’m not releasing is that it would basically vary for every base as far as getting specific things to function, and I cba to write a tutorial for every popular base.

Then let them do it themselves, otherwise spoon feeding will never die.
[/quote]

Exactly what I’m thinking ;), I’ll release the classes and give a basic overview on how to make the buttons and such function and leave the rest to them.

@ Jason, This is going to be mainly for iVitality, testing it on the server first[/quote]
Ah, alrighty then.

Read full topic
